text: <extra_id_0> Bruton's agammaglobulinemia tyrosine kinase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> Btk <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) is a cytoplasmic tyrosine kinase involved in the human disease X - linked agammaglobulinemia ( XLA ) .
The gene is expressed in all hematopoietic cells with the exception of T-cells and plasma cells .
For this expression pattern the first 280 bp upstream of the major transcriptional start site seems to be sufficient .
In vitro footprinting analysis within this part of the promoter revealed two <extra_id_0> Sp1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binding sites as well as a PU-box .

The transcription factor <extra_id_0> Spi-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> PU.1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> as well as the closely related factor <extra_id_0> Spi-B <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> bound to the PU-box in B-cells .

text: Mutation of either site reduced the expression in transient transfection experiments .
However , mutation of the PU box had no effect in the T-cell line Jurkat , where none of the <extra_id_0> Spi-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> family members is expressed .

In addition <extra_id_0> Spi-B <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> as well as <extra_id_0> PU.1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> were able to transactivate <extra_id_0> Btk <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression .
